ls_population Struct Reference

#include <ls_pop.h>

Detailed Description

A population of L-Systems.

Definition at line 22 of file ls_pop.h.

Data Fields

lsystem ** ls_array
 The population itself.
int num_parents
 The number of parents in the population.
int numrules
 The number of rules in every L-System in this population. It has to be at least two since the first one is the axiom.
int pop_size
 The size of the population.

int ls_population::numrules

The number of rules in every L-System in this population. It has to be at least two since the first one is the axiom.

Definition at line 28 of file ls_pop.h.

Referenced by assignRandomValues(), createPopulation(), and mutateChildren().

int ls_population::pop_size

The size of the population.

The size of the population is at most
number_of_parents + number_of_parents = number of parents + number of children.
This is because every pair of parents produces two children.

Definition at line 42 of file ls_pop.h.

Referenced by assignRandomValues(), createPopulation(), deletePopulation(), main(), mutateChildren(), printall(), and sortpopulation().
